item.title: Trump-appointed judge blocks access to widely used abortion drug
item.description: A federal judge in Texas has ordered to halt the FDA’s approval of mifepristone, set to take effect in seven days unless an appeals court intervenes
item.dc:creator: Alex Woodward

item.title: How Tennessee GOP's majority used power to expel Democrats
item.description: The expulsion of two Tennessee Democrats over a gun control protest is an extraordinary showcase of how the levers of single-party power in America’s statehouses can be pulled not only to shut down opponents, but also to punish them

item.title: WSJ reporter arrested in Russia formally charged with espionage
item.description: The White House has listed the reporter as “wrongfully detained”

media:content.media:text: The Wall Street Journal journalist Evan Gershkovich is shown in this undated photo. The U.S. Senate's top two leaders, in a rare bipartisan statement, demanded on Friday that Russia immediately release Evan Gershkovich, condemning the detention of the Wall Street Journal reporter and declaring that “journalism is not a crime.” (The Wall Street Journal via AP, File) - (ASSOCIATED PRESS)
